passage_text: • INGESTION (noun). The noun INGESTION has 1 sense: 1. the process of taking food into the body through the mouth (as by eating). Familiarity information: INGESTION used as a noun is very rare.

1 It doesn't interfere with any other ingestive behaviors such as food or water, which amperozide does a little in the animals. 2  Decreased ingestive behavior, impaired cognitive functioning, increased sleep, and altered mood have been reported by individuals experiencing immune activation or cytokine treatment. 1 Every physical ailment is classified as warm or cold, and its cure depends on restoring the body's equilibrium by ingesting foods with the opposite properties. 2  The gut model only allows for a mass intake on a daily basis that does not exceed the mass of the animal ingesting the food.
Full Definition of INGEST. transitive verb. : to take in for or as if for digestion. — in·gest·ible \-ˈjes-tə-bəl\ adjective. — in·ges·tion \-ˈjes-chən, -ˈjesh-\ noun.

1. ingestion-the process of taking food into the body through the mouth (as by eating). consumption, intake, uptake. eating, feeding-the act of consuming food. deglutition, swallow, drink-the act of swallowing; one swallow of the liquid was enough; he took a drink of his beer and smacked his lips.

Principal Translations. ingestion nnoun: Refers to person, place, thing, quality, etc. (consumption, swallowing). ingestion ingestión nfnombre: Femenino sustantivo de genero género (exclusivamente, femenino). mesa tabla ingesta: Nfnombre femenino sustantivo de genero (género, exclusivamente). femenino mesa tabla

Ingestion is the consumption of a substance by an organism. In animals, it normally is accomplished by taking in the substance through the mouth into the gastrointestinal tract, such as through eating or drinking. In single-celled organisms, ingestion can take place through taking the substance through the cell membrane. Ingestion can also refer to a mechanism picking up something and making it enter an internal hollow of that mechanism, e.g.  a grille was fitted to prevent the pump from ingesting driftwood .

1 Take (food, drink, or another substance) into the body by swallowing or absorbing it: lead will poison anyone if enough is ingested they ingest oxygen from the air. More example sentences. 1  Frugivorous vertebrates ingest fruits and the seeds within, later defecating the seeds. 1 Every physical ailment is classified as warm or cold, and its cure depends on restoring the body's equilibrium by ingesting foods with the opposite properties. 2  The gut model only allows for a mass intake on a daily basis that does not exceed the mass of the animal ingesting the food.
